00012 ExponentialSampLikelihood::ExponentialSampLikelihood(double Lambda)
00013 {
00014         likelihoodLambda = Lambda;
00015         likelihoodLikpar = 1 / Lambda;

00022 ExponentialSampLikelihood::ExponentialSampLikelihood(double Lambda, double (*_transform)(double))
00023 {
00024     likelihoodLambda = Lambda;
00025     likelihoodLikpar = 1 / Lambda;
00026     transform = _transform;
00027 }

00033 // TODO  we need a variance check to make sure the variance doesn't collapse
00034 
00035 double ExponentialSampLikelihood::updateCoefficients(double& K1, double& K2, double Observation, double ModelMean, double ModelVariance) const
00036 {
00037     double sigX = sqrt(ModelVariance);
00038         double y = Observation;
00039 
00040         // importance sampler mean and deviation
00041         double mq = ModelMean;
00042         
00043         // Inflate the prior in the initial population Monte Carlo run
00044         // This is an arbitrary factor - increase for the exponential case
00045         // to ensure that some samples fall below the observations.
00046         double sq = 8.0 * sigX;   
00047         double ev = 0, pM = 0, pV = 0;
00048         
00049         // population monte carlo bit here
00050         for(int iCyc=0; iCyc < SamplingLikelihood::numberCycles; iCyc++)
00051         {
00052             // Sample from the variance-inflated model 
00053                 vec sx = mq + (itpp::randn(SamplingLikelihood::numberSamples) * sq);
00054                 
00055                 vec transH = apply_function(transform, sx);
00056                 
00057                 //      computing weights
00058                 vec importanceWeights = (itpp::pow((sx - ModelMean) / sigX, 2.0) - itpp::pow((sx - mq) / sq, 2.0)) / 2.0;
00059                 
00060                 importanceWeights = itpp::exp(-importanceWeights) * sq / sigX;
00061                 
00062                 //      multiply the importance weight with likelihood
00063                 vec likFunc = likelihoodLambda * exp(-likelihoodLambda*abs(y - transH));
00064                 
00065                 // Under the exponential likelihood, we must have y>x (the 
00066                 // tranformed samples must lie under the observation - this is
00067                 // due to the one sided nature of postitive exponential noise).
00068                 // Discard samples that do not conform to that inequality 
00069                 for(int i=0 ; i < likFunc.length(); i++) {
00070                         if( y <= transH(i)) {
00071                                 likFunc(i) = 0.0;
00072                         }
00073                 }
00074                 
00075                 importanceWeights = itpp::elem_mult(importanceWeights, likFunc);
00076                 
00077                 ev = itpp::sum(importanceWeights);
00078                 importanceWeights = importanceWeights / ev;
00079                 
00080                 
00081                 pM = itpp::sum(itpp::elem_mult(sx, importanceWeights));         
00082                 pV = itpp::sum(itpp::elem_mult(itpp::pow(sx, 2.0), importanceWeights)) - pow(pM, 2.0);
00083                 
00084                 //      Update the proposal distribution
00085                 mq = pM;
00086                 sq = sqrt(abs(pV));
00087         }
00088 
00089         K1 = (pM - ModelMean) / ModelVariance;
00090         K2 = -(ModelVariance - pV) / pow(ModelVariance, 2.0);
00091 
00092         return log(ev);
00093         
00094 }
